Class Headings

  • java.lang.Object
    • Headings

  • public class Headings
extends java.lang.Object
    Headings objects contain trees of top-level headings that may or may not contain subheadings. The contents of the tree will be iterated throughout, turned into string that will replace the sections tag of the master templates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Headings() 
      Headings(TEMPLATE template)
      Headings objects contain trees of top-level headings that may or may not contain subheadings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Heading h)
      Adds a top level heading.
      java.lang.String formatRTF()
      Iterates through all sections provided by the user (headings and subheadings), surrounding them with the proper styling for display in Rich Text Format documents.
      java.lang.String formatRTFToC() 
      java.lang.String formatTeX()
      Iterates through all sections provided by the user (headings and subheadings), surrounding them with the proper formatting for LaTeX source code.
      java.lang.String getAll()
      Returns one string of the headings separated by newlines, with subheadings tabbed in.
      int getCount()
      Returns number of headings in heading tree
      Heading getHeading(int index)
      Returns the heading indicated by the index
      void remove(Heading h)
      Removes the heading indicated by h.
      void remove(int index)
      Removes the heading located at the supplied index.
      void setHeading(int index, Heading h)
      Sets the supplied heading at the supplied index.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Headings

        public Headings(TEMPLATE template)
        Headings objects contain trees of top-level headings that may or may not contain subheadings.
        Parameters:
        template - Paramater of enum type TEMPLATE that denotes the default master template to fill the GUI/user document with.

    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        public java.lang.String getAll()
        Returns one string of the headings separated by newlines, with subheadings tabbed in.
        Returns:
        String containing all document sections, separated by newlines, with subheadings tabbed in below their respective headings.

      • formatTeX

        public java.lang.String formatTeX()
        Iterates through all sections provided by the user (headings and subheadings), surrounding them with the proper formatting for LaTeX source code.
        Returns:
        s String containing LaTeX formatting for sections

      • formatRTF

        public java.lang.String formatRTF()
        Iterates through all sections provided by the user (headings and subheadings), surrounding them with the proper styling for display in Rich Text Format documents.
        Returns:
        s String containing RTF formatting for sections
